content.question: Which of the following statements best describes the voice leading in measure 9 ?

choices.label: The chordal seventh in the supertonic seventh chord on beat 1 resolves down by step on beat 2.
The chordal seventh in the supertonic seventh chord on beat 1 resolves up by step on beat 2.
The chordal seventh in the supertonic seventh chord on beat 1 is retained in the cadential six-four chord on beat 2 and resolves down by step on beat 3.
The chordal seventh in the supertonic seventh chord on beat 1 is retained in the cadential six-four chord on beat 2 and resolves up by step on beat 3.

content.answer: The chordal seventh in the supertonic seventh chord on beat 1 is retained in the cadential six-four chord on beat 2 and resolves down by step on beat 3.

unit.text: 5: Harmony and Voice Leading II - Chord Progressions and Predominant Function

skill.text: Skill 2.E: Use symbols and terms to describe and apply harmonic, melodic, and rhythmic procedures of 18th-century voice leading (up to 4 voices) in notated music.
